title: Grade 5 Math Geometry and Spatial Sense

questions.definition: An angle that measures exactly 90 degrees.
A triangle with all three sides of equal length.
An angle that measures less than 90 degrees.
An angle that measures more than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees.
A quadrilateral with four right angles and opposite sides of equal length.
A two-dimensional pattern that can be folded into a three-dimensional figure.
A three-dimensional figure with two parallel, congruent bases connected by rectangular faces.
A three-dimensional figure with a polygonal base and triangular faces that meet at a single point.
The movement of a shape from one position to another without rotating or flipping it.
One of the four cardinal directions, opposite of south.
One of the four cardinal directions, to the right of north on a compass.
A transformation that flips a shape over a line, creating a mirror image.
Two shapes that are identical in size and shape.
Lines in a plane that never intersect, no matter how far they extend.
Lines that intersect to form right angles.
A diagram on a map that shows directions such as north, south, east, and west.
A transformation that turns a shape around a fixed point.
